caption: Large open basin surrounded by restaurants and attractions, including boat hire (season dependent) close to line 7 metro. Good place to start or finish a nice walk along the canal st Martin
An extension of the canal, quite a lovely place to stroll along enjoying the tranquility.
Very nice place to run, walk, or just sit and have a beer or two during the evening. Close to the park nice green area for a pic nic  Lively to take the dogs for a pleasant walk also.
Good to üèÉ run or üö≤ bike

Beach üèñ in Paris üëçüèº Weldon üëçüèº for kids & also for adults who are in Paris to enjoy the summer. Regularly doing Few activities in summer. This summer from 9 July to 21 August. Also few more places in Paris . Follow the QR code for the information in the photo ‚Ä¶üçÄn the map ‚Ä¶

Saw the Eiffel tower and all that, but my favourite part of my trip to Paris was watching the locals playing ping pong in this park. These people are seriously talented! Great place to sit with a beer and people watch!

Great place to swim. Swim area has lifeguards on staff, changing rooms and showers and best of all it‚Äôs free.  Remember a picture ID if you want to use a locker. They also had lots of free games and activities going on for the kids such as a zip line, carousel, paddle boats
Great place to go for a swim. No cost and no queue when we were there. They opened at 13:30 closed for cleaning around 3:30-4 before opening up again.
Such a lovely ambience. I especially enjoyed the afrobeats played..
If only more cities could do initiativet like this one
Never thought I‚Äôd be able to natural swim in Paris. Incredible public infrastructure!
Cool in hot weather but stay safe

Nice place to hang out and watch the passersby and the little boats on the canal. You can have a drink, play petanque, rent a little boat, or just walk along the water with an ice cream. It is by default very relaxing.
Seems to be a really cool place. Apparently closed due to Corona. The pools are quite dirty.

A nice place to swim though it is a bit chilly. The staff are friendly and the place has a nice view of the canal. The water was clean and when you jump out of the water you can sit on a comfy deck chair.
A great place to promenade and stroll along.

It‚Äôs a great spot to swim outdoors in the centre of Paris, but why oh why is it not open until mid July?! We cycled across the city to visit on a 30 degree day in June and the place was shut. I suspect however that this is a problem across French swimming establishments.
Lovely cool drink and good service
Would have given it 5 stars but at the top end it stinks of piss.
Nice park swimming by the river. No food kiosks.

Not so much a tourist destination, but there are attractions along the canal. Movie theaters, boat rides, shops, and a fountain. The fountain was under construction. I imagine for the upcoming Olympics.
A lovely place to play and relax.

Great location on a hot day.  Brought a group of 30, about 25 got in the water - great way to cool off.  Keep an eye on your bags, some shady looking people seemed to be watching bags anytime they were left unattended.

Gorgeous walk by the river with several restaurants and public spaces, at the afternoons is a very nice option to have a glass of wine and a great talk with friends. There is also a cinema in case of feeling like watching a movie.

Giving two stars mainly for how the bassin is handled. We arrived last weekend a bit before 18 (it's open till 21). It was already full which is understandable with the nice weather. And I like they keep a maximum number of people to not get overcrowded or create unsafe situations. What I would have not expected, is that once it's full they close! They don't let people in, even when numerous families leaving. So at 19.30 it was basically empty, with another 90 minutes till "offical" closing time and they just keep it closed. I would love to understand the reasoning behind it because would that mean that if the Bassin is full at let's say, 10:30 - they would not open up for the entire day?!
We rented an electric boat. We brought snacks and music.
Pretty Cool place, you can buy the cheapest spritz in town for 7 euros
Positive: The entrance is free and you can actually go swimming in the Seine. Negative: there are barley places to lay down, so there is no real beach atmosphere; the place is not very clean overall.

Superb time we had there, it was our hotel by the canal, photos are from there, weather was beautiful went for a walk by the banal you can see boats going by, there were quiet a few cafes there, tables and chairs were out people enjoying their wines and food children playing excellent
Very nice place
The place is good, but the water is dirty and cold. Also, inside the pool, the floor is too much glazy.
My experience in le bassin de la Villette is awesome experience i haven't received such services before and  I felt more comfortable to eat there, i spent some time.
Pretty but you cannot go far on the electric boates. So-so
Great place for running and relax! The one minus is that i do not feel it is very safe at night
It's alright, but not much to see. If you walk towards La Villette Park, you'll have better view
Perfect place for hot days
A nice surprise in the city of light.
Its closed even though it should be opened according to the internet, very sad because its beautiful
